snippet: China’s new national security committee, which is expected to be led by President Xi Jinping, will deal with cybersecurity, relations with Tibet and unrest in the Xinjiang region, Chinese experts say.
abstract: China’s new national security committee, which is expected to be led by Pres Xi Jinping, will deal with cybersecurity, relations with Tibet and unrest in the Xinjiang region.

byline.contributor: Chris Buckley contributed reporting from Hong Kong.

lead_paragraph: China’s new national security committee, which is expected to be led by President Xi Jinping, will deal with cybersecurity, relations with Tibet and unrest in the Xinjiang region, Chinese experts say.

headline.main: New Chinese Panel Said to Oversee Domestic Security and Foreign Policy
headline.print_headline: New Chinese Panel Said to Oversee Domestic Security and Foreign Policy

keywords.value: Politburo Standing Committee of the Communist Party of China
